page.title: 18A days fishing in Filey.
page.content: On Saturdays and Sundays my father takes my cousin,Alan,and myself fishing.We set off at 4.30a.m. and it takes us about 45 minutes to reach the fishing ground about seven miles off shore.During the week they use nets and pots to catch the fish,crabs and lobsters.When I am with them they use rods and lines and we catch cod, haddock,dogfish and blegg.We arrive back in Filey at about 1p.m. When they get back to Filey the catch is taken to the Fishermen's shop in West Road.It is then filleted and sent to market. When they go 'potting' it takes about 20 minutes to haul in a fleet of pots.There are 25 pots in a fleet and my father has 6 fleets.My father has a blue coble called 'Deep Harmony'.
